I thought the "secret location" was a hoot too.  I mean it is frigging HUGE=
!  It's not like you can miss it :))




________________________________
F=
rom: Misty Dawn <bulletbabea@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: T=
hu, December 31, 2009 12:19:21 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Big Mistake!

  
S=
orry to hear that Frank. I can think of plenty of actual researchers who wo=
uld love to test one and are already getting great results with other metho=
ds and versions of your work. I am also sorry I didnt make it very far past=
 the second paragraph. Karen obviously does not research before she writes =
her articles.
 
"However, the precise location of the Sanatorium is a close=
ly guarded secret." 
 
Ummm Karen needs to learn to use Google as well. If =
she had she would have been able to print out a map to Waverly which includ=
es information such as tracks, businesses, adresses AND golf courses at the=
 corner.  It even shows you an overhead view of each building you pass alon=
g the way on each street. Hint to Karen click sattelite view after you expl=
ore closeups of map view. 
 
Im sorry but if you are going to write a well =
informed article the first step is become well informed. I wont bother read=
ing the rest of her articles because I wont waste my time looking at resear=
ch from someone who cant bother to cover the basics like look at a map befo=
re you drive out to someplace you've never been before and then misinform p=
eople that it is in a secret location. Nor do I see walking on a tour as as=
 actual "investigation" .
 
Alot of the people once believed the earth was =
flat, unfortunately they were not "well informed" and they too were victims=
 of shoddy research. Luckily there are those who do look beyond the horizon=
 and open their minds to the possibility that there is more out there.
 
Ha=
ppy New Years everyone and may your journey next year be in the right direc=
tion!
 
Misty

he tested the box "scientifically, and can prove it does not work. 
> 
> Ka=
ren had contacted me via e-mail requesting a meeting. I thought she was som=
eone off the group and has an interest in EVP and the boxes. She did mentio=
n she was a skeptic, but I didn't think debunker, or a professional skeptic=
--wonder who pays these twits?
> 
> 
> These skeptics don't allow themselve=
s to hear anything, yet will proclaim that as proof the boxes and EVP don't=
 work, as if their hearing is somehow better than the average persons ear. =
If a person doesn't want to hear it, they won't, and because they can''t he=
ar EVP that means no one else an either.  Yeah, real scientific!
> 
> Gonna=
 have to remember Google-googel- google!!
> 
> Frank-S
